2025.title: Generative UX Components
2025.description: On-demand generation of UI components (layouts, icons, copy) using large models tailored to product data and brand tokens.

2025.title: Progressive Hydration
2025.description: Fine-grained hydration strategies that progressively activate interactivity to minimize JavaScript and speed up Time to Interactive.

2025.title: Composable Data Mesh for Frontend
2025.description: Decoupled data products and contract-driven APIs that enable teams to compose complex UIs from reusable data services.

2025.title: Zero-trust Web Authentication
2025.description: Stronger, passwordless authentication patterns (WebAuthn, passkeys) combined with continuous risk signals for secure sessions.

2025.title: Sustainable Web Practices
2025.description: Design and engineering patterns focused on energy-efficient web apps, lower carbon footprints, and measurable sustainability metrics.

2025.title: Astro.js
2025.description: Astro.js is a cutting-edge static site generator designed to make building fast, content-focused websites easier than ever. It embraces the modern concept of shipping less JavaScript by default, making web experiences lightning fast, lightweight, and user-friendly. Unlike traditional frameworks that rely heavily on client-side hydration, Astro renders the majority of your site to static HTML during build time, dramatically improving performance metrics such as Time to Interactive (TTI) and Core Web Vitals. Astro offers a unique component-based architecture that allows developers to use popular frontend frameworks like React, Vue, Svelte, or Solid within a single project. This flexibility means teams can work with the tools they already love while still benefiting from Astro’s zero-JS-by-default philosophy. Astro also includes powerful features such as islands architecture for partial hydration, server-side rendering (SSR), Markdown and MDX support, and a thriving plugin ecosystem that integrates seamlessly with tools like Tailwind CSS, Content Collections, and image optimization. Developers can create dynamic sites, blogs, portfolios, and documentation platforms that load instantly and rank highly on search engines. Furthermore, Astro prioritizes developer experience by offering an intuitive file-based routing system, hot module replacement (HMR), TypeScript support, and rich error handling. With its focus on sustainability, performance, and simplicity, Astro.js represents a significant step toward the future of web development—where speed, maintainability, and accessibility coexist in perfect harmony.

2025.title: SolidStart
2025.description: SolidStart is the official framework for Solid.js, offering hybrid rendering, file-based routing, and optimized performance for modern web apps.

2025.title: Remix Run
2025.description: Remix Run focuses on web fundamentals, offering nested routing, fast data loading, and seamless server rendering for resilient web applications.

2025.title: SvelteKit
2025.description: SvelteKit enables developers to build fast, optimized web apps with minimal overhead, server-side rendering, and first-class TypeScript support.

2025.title: Next.js 15
2025.description: Next.js 15 introduces enhanced server components, React compiler support, and improved static generation for performance-driven applications.

2025.title: Nuxt 4
2025.description: Nuxt 4 delivers hybrid rendering, type-safe routes, and Vue 3 Composition API support, making it ideal for universal Vue applications.

2025.title: Vite 6
2025.description: Vite 6 provides next-generation frontend tooling with ultra-fast Hot Module Replacement and first-class TypeScript and JSX support.

2025.title: Capacitor 6
2025.description: Capacitor 6 by Ionic simplifies native mobile app development using web technologies and offers tighter integration with modern frameworks.

2025.title: Electron Forge
2025.description: Electron Forge streamlines Electron app packaging, auto-updates, and deployment, helping developers ship cross-platform desktop apps efficiently.
